item.title: Allow rendering collection of components
item.description:
When rendering jbuilder partials, the following can be used instead of explicitly writing a loop that renders each partial:

```ruby
json.partial! \"posts/post\", collection: @posts, as: :post
```

It would be interesting if we could have something similar for components. The example below assumes a PostComponent is defined.

```ruby
# posts_controller.rb

class PostsController < ApplicationController
def index
@posts = Post.scope_that_queries_the_right_posts(params)
end
end

# app/views/posts/index.html.erb

<%= render @posts %>
```

In this case, for each record we would get the associated component and render it. I'd love some feedback and implementations ideas. I can work on some implementation suggestions."

item.title: Include test case class for components
item.description:
Here is what I'm currently using on my `test_helper.rb` file.

```ruby
class ActionView::ComponentTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
include ActionView::Component::TestHelpers
end
```

I think it's a good idea to provide this base for class for testing components."

item.title: Compile components on application boot
item.description: In production, it would probably make sense to `compile` all descendents of `ActionView::Component::Base`, so that components render quickly on the first request, instead of compiling lazily as they do now."

item.title: Provisioning: Validation of valid org id is missing for datasources, dashboards, and notifiers
item.description:
**What happened**:
Datasources provided in datasource.yml file getting inserted into the database even the orgId doesn't exist in DB
**What you expected to happen**:
Datasources should not be inserted into the db if org Id doesn't exist
**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible) **:
Steps to reproduce
1) In datasource.yml file change the org Id to id doesn't exist in org Table
2) Trigger the reload API /api/admin/provisioning/dashboards/reload
3) check datasource table you will be seeing record with this datasource

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Grafana version:
- Data source type & version: Postgres 11
- OS Grafana is installed on: Linux
- User OS & Browser: Windows and Chrome

item.title: Self signed certificates
item.description:
I tested the render plugin against a Grafana instance with self signed certificate. I got the following error:
Error: net::ERR_CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID

Would be nice with a config parameter to trust unsigned certificates as that's probably the issue."
